job.title: Senior System Engineer (32529)
job.description:
The Senior System Engineer will contribute to our clients program in conducting advance performance assessment studies for system configurations as needed to provide solution for complex customer needs. Using his / her expertise in satellite communications, orbital configuration and large communication networks, the candidate will define solutions with enough details to enable implementation across their system.

Main Responsibilities

  • Develop new solutions to commercial needs using their system, including among others solutions for low latency high capacity services, hosted satellite (space relay) services, mobile services, and other new configurations to support opportunities.
  • Support sales activities by evaluating complex use cases using internal and commercially available simulation tools.
  • Evaluate system performance boundaries by incorporating realistic user traffic profiles and terminal mix.
  • Help prepare and manage feature development roadmap in collaboration with commercial and engineering teams by evaluating value-add.
  • Develop technical documentation and reports.
  • Prepare and deliver high quality technical presentations supporting the delivery of solutions.

Education and Experience Required

  • B. Sc. in Electrical, Computer or System Engineering and a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in satellite communications or other large communication systems.
  • Experience in system simulations and service performance assessments.
  • Programming experience in Matlab and / or Python.
  • Knowledge of radio communication systems and/or satellite communication is desirable (experience with link budgets is an asset).

Specialized Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Creative problem-solver with thorough attention to detail.
  • Highly collaborative team-player who can quickly earn the confidence of co-workers and teammates.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Experience with STK for orbital analyses is an asset.
  • Fluent in English, written and oral.
  • Computers running Windows and Linux

job.title: Local to Michigan -Cloud Architect, Hybrid (SOM-144546) (32642)
job.description:
Myticas' direct client, based in Lansing, MI, is seeking a Cloud Architect to work on a hybrid schedule in Lansing, MI (on-site 2 days per week).

Please Note:

  • Position Location: Lansing, MI. The resource will follow a hybrid schedule and must be on-site from day one, two days a week (typically Tuesdays and Wednesdays).
  • Local candidates are strongly preferred, but non-local candidates may apply if willing to relocate at their own expense and adhere to the hybrid schedule without delays.

Top Required Skills & Years of Experience:

  • Experience: 5+ years in the field.
  • Strong expertise in .NET, HTML, XML, SQL, SOAP, REST, PowerShell, IaC, Microsoft Azure, and Function Apps.
  • Hands-on experience writing and implementing Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
  • Comprehensive knowledge of Microsoft Azure, web-based systems, and client-server-based architecture.

Preferred Skills:

  • Ability to conduct interviews and build effective relationships with system users.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Visio and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint).
  • Experience in analyzing, designing, programming, testing, implementing, and supporting web-based applications on the Microsoft/Windows platform (e.g., ASP.NET framework 4.8 or higher, .NET 6 or higher).

Job Summary:

The Cloud Application Architect will serve as a technical expert for the Michigan Center for Educational Performance and Information (CEPI). This role involves designing and orchestrating the placement and interaction of application components to meet business requirements while balancing factors such as sustainability, cost control, standardization, security, compliance, and strategic alignment.

This position will focus on IT system modernization initiatives within the CEPI portfolio and ensure seamless integration of the CEPI Cloud infrastructure with COTS packages, SaaS, Web Services, and other federal, state, and local government applications and services (both internal and external to the State).

The Cloud Architect will provide technical expertise and leadership to the application development team, promoting usability, security, mobility, maintainability, and reusability. This role requires minimal supervision and involves significant collaboration with program managers and technology oversight groups. The architect will work as part of a team of architects/designers, supported by additional staff.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead the development and application of technical architecture strategies.
  • Analyze technical and business problems and recommend solutions to improve processes and enable productivity.
  • Collaborate with other architects and developers to select and adapt cloud architecture frameworks and tools to project needs.

Required Skills/Experience:

  • In-depth knowledge of complex cloud application development environments and practices.
  • Ability to gather and analyze facts, define problems, and recommend solutions.
  • Thorough understanding of cloud application development architecture, frameworks, and tools.
  • Advanced knowledge of business requirements, network-based application orchestration, database management, and application development.
  • Expertise in advanced cloud application development and integration techniques.
  • Strong proficiency in .NET, HTML, XML, SQL, SOAP, REST, PowerShell, IaC, Microsoft Azure, and Function Apps.
  • Knowledge of secure coding and authorization concepts, relational database principles, web services, and microservices architecture.
  • Experience with distributed tracing and observability.
  • Proficient in creating and maintaining distributed applications using microservices.
  • Excellent technical documentation and presentation skills.
  • Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting abilities in high-stress environments.
  • Self-motivated, capable of managing tasks independently with minimal supervision.

Additional Qualifications:

  • Knowledge/training in object-oriented analysis, design, and programming.
  • Familiarity with cloud application and database development methods.
  • Ability to prepare detailed instructions and documentation.
  • Capacity to establish and maintain effective relationships with clients and support teams.

This role requires a candidate who can work efficiently under pressure, handle complex assignments, and deliver optimum solutions in a timely manner. The ideal candidate will be proactive, technically skilled, and collaborative, ensuring successful delivery of cloud architecture projects.

job.title: SAP FICO Functional Lead - Oil & Gas (32637)

This leadership role will play a key part in driving finance-related workstreams, providing expert guidance on core SAP FI/CO modules, and aligning solution delivery to the needs of an asset-intensive organization.

  • Ensure alignment with industry best practices and EY methodology for SAP implementations

  • Support UAT, cutover planning, data migration, and go-live activities

  • Lead or mentor junior consultants and ensure effective knowledge transfer

Required Qualifications:

  • 10+ years of SAP FICO experience with at least 2 full-cycle implementations

  • Proven functional leadership experience on large-scale SAP projects

  • Strong background in asset-intensive industries (oil and gas preferred)

The ideal candidate will thrive in a collaborative environment, have a passion for automation and modern DevOps practices, and be eager to take ownership in a hands-on technical role.

Education:

Experience:

job.title: Cloud Operations Engineer (32574)
job.description:
Job Title: Cloud Operations Engineer
Location: Vancouver, BC

Qualifications Required

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Cybersecurity, or a related field. Equivalent professional experience will also be considered.

  • A minimum of 7 years of experience in Azure cloud operations, with a strong focus on security and vulnerability management.

  • Proven experience in managing and securing large-scale Azure environments in production settings.

  • Hands-on experience with vulnerability scanning, remediation, and compliance within enterprise cloud infrastructures.

  • Extensive experience in security incident response and threat mitigation in Azure environments.

Technical Skills

Azure Expertise

  • Deep understanding of core Azure services, including:

    • Azure Security Center

    • Microsoft Defender for Cloud

    • Azure Key Vault

    • Azure Policy

    • Azure Sentinel (SIEM)

    • Azure Active Directory (Azure AD)

Security and Vulnerability Tools

  • Proficient in using tools such as Qualys, Tenable Nessus, or Rapid7 for vulnerability scanning and management.

  • Experience with native Azure security tools for threat detection and remediation.

Infrastructure Hardening

  • Strong knowledge of best practices for securing Azure resources such as virtual machines, storage accounts, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), and network components.

  • Familiarity with zero-trust architecture principles and their implementation in Azure.

Automation and Scripting

  • Advanced scripting skills using PowerShell, Azure CLI, Python, or other automation tools.

  • Experience in integrating security checks and controls within CI/CD pipelines.

Certifications (Preferred or Mandatory)

Azure Cloud Certifications

  • Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate (AZ-104)

  • Microsoft Certified: Azure Security Engineer Associate (AZ-500)

  • Microsoft Certified: Cybersecurity Architect Expert (SC-100)

Security Certifications

  • Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)

  • Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)

  • CompTIA Security+

  • GIAC certifications (e.g., GCIH, GSEC, GCED)

Other Requirements

  • Familiarity with regulatory and compliance standards such as ISO 27001, SOC 2, GDPR, and HIPAA.

  • Experience conducting or supporting cloud security audits.

  • Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with emerging cloud and cybersecurity technologies and trends.

job.title: Senior ASIC Design & Product Integration Engineer (32623)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a Senior ASIC Design and Product Integration Engineer to join their team working on cutting-edge ASIC technology.

Main Responsibilities:
  • Translate high-level system requirements into detailed IC specifications.
  • Drive ASIC design validation, performance evaluation, and reliability testing.
  • Serve as the technical liaison between ASIC designers and hardware integration teams.
  • Manage the delivery of prototype silicon for validation and analysis.
  • Perform statistical data analysis on large datasets to assess and enhance IC performance.
  • Troubleshoot silicon issues and drive resolution collaboratively with design teams.
  • Support manufacturing ramp-up with yield, capability, and supply planning assessments.
  • Develop technical documentation and application notes for IC integration support.Hands-on experience in analog ASIC product or application engineering, across multiple product development cycles.
Required Skills and Qualifications:
  • Strong understanding of analog circuit behavior and device physics, with a proven track record in failure analysis and performance optimization.
  • Proficiency in statistical data analysis and large dataset handling.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to engage cross-functional teams.
  • Programming and process development experience is a strong asset.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Physics.
  • MS with 4+ years, or PhD with 2+ years of relevant experience in analog ASIC product or application engineering.
Location:
Hybrid, United States.

job.title: High-Speed Analog ASIC Engineer (32624)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a talented High-Speed Analog Engineer to join their innovative team building next-generation >100Gbaud integrated circuits for high-performance data center and communication products.

Responsibilities:
  • Lead the design, layout, and bring-up of ultra-high-speed analog ICs.
  • Contribute to all phases of IC development, including validation and characterization.
  • Collaborate with verification, CAD, product, and test engineering teams to execute design verification test (DVT) plans.
  • Support product performance evaluation and refinement in the lab environment.
Required Skills and Experience:
  • Experience designing high-speed analog ICs using SiGe BiCMOS or CMOS technologies.
  • Solid understanding of transmission lines and high-frequency passive structures.
  • Strong grasp of device physics and its impact on analog performance.
  • Hands-on experience with RF wafer probing and lab evaluation of high-speed ICs.
  • Familiarity with VerilogA and scripting (Skill, Python, shell) is an asset.
  • Effective communicator and strong team player.
Qualifications:
  • BS in Electrical Engineering or related field with 5+ years of relevant experience
  • MS with 3+ years of experience
  • PhD in a related field (experience level flexible)
Location:
Hybrid – United States

job.title: Principal ASIC Verification Engineer (32625)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a Principal ASIC Verification Engineer to join a high-performing team developing leading-edge technology for next-generation optical networks and data centers.

Responsibilities:
  • Drive the development of verification infrastructure using SystemVerilog and UVM.
  • Create protocol/traffic generators, checkers, and testbenches aligned with functional and standards-based requirements.
  • Define and implement test plans at the block and sub-chip levels for advanced digital ASICs.
  • Develop and execute self-checking test environments to ensure thorough validation.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams in a geographically distributed environment.
  • Optionally lead small teams or verification efforts for key deliverables.
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field (Master’s preferred).
  • 10+ years of experience in ASIC verification with hands-on expertise in UVM and SystemVerilog.
  • Solid knowledge of assertions, functional and code coverage, and formal verification tools.
  • Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.
  • Experience with DSP and/or FEC is a plus.
Location:
Hybrid – Canada

job.title: Lead Mixed - Signal IC Design Engineer - High -Speed Circuits (32627)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a Lead Mixed-Signal IC Design Engineer- High-Speed Circuits to join a cutting-edge team building advanced analog and mixed-signal IP for next-generation communications and data center systems.

Responsibilities:
  • Design, implement, and simulate high-speed analog blocks such as ADCs, DACs, and PLLs.
  • Optimize floorplans, supervise layout teams, and provide layout guidance (including hands-on layout work when needed).
  • Evaluate and select circuit topologies to meet stringent performance goals in terms of power, area, linearity, and bandwidth.
  • Develop test plans and collaborate with product and test engineering teams for validation and characterization.
  • Follow established design flows and contribute to process improvements.
  • Model analog circuits using Verilog-A/AMS for system-level simulations.
Key Qualifications:
  • Strong experience with CAD tools: Cadence Virtuoso, Spectre, Incisive, Calibre, EMX, Totem EM/IR.
  • Proven track record designing and bringing to production high-speed analog/mixed-signal IPs in deep submicron CMOS (e.g., high-speed ADCs, DACs, low-jitter PLLs).
  • In-depth understanding of analog circuit methodologies, layout effects, and device physics.
  • Experience with behavioral modeling (Verilog-A/AMS).
  • Ability to work collaboratively with distributed design teams.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and effective communication.
  • Experience with Matlab and/or optical communication theory is a plus.
Education & Experience:
  • M.S. in Electrical Engineering with 12+ years of experience, or
  • Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering with 8+ years of experience.
Location:
Hybrid – United States

job.title: Lead Custom Analog Layout Engineeer (32628)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a Lead Custom Analog Layout Engineer to support the development of high-performance analog and mixed-signal ICs for next-generation communication and data center systems. In this hybrid U.S.-based role, you'll collaborate closely with circuit designers to ensure optimal layout quality, performance, and delivery timelines.

Responsibilities:
  • Partner with circuit designers to optimize block- and chip-level floorplans.
  • Perform daily layout editing, verification (DRC/LVS), and quality checks using industry-standard tools.
  • Apply best practices and efficient layout methodologies to streamline design cycles.
  • Contribute to chip-level integration, including P&R and top-level planning.
Key Qualifications:
  • Extensive experience using layout tools such as Cadence Virtuoso and/or Laker.
  • Proficiency in DRC/LVS/ERC verification flows (e.g., Calibre, PVS, IC Validator).
  • Solid understanding of layout challenges including IR drop, EM, RC delay, crosstalk, self-heating, and analog matching techniques.
  • Hands-on experience designing layouts for precision analog blocks like SD-ADC, SAR-ADC, bandgaps, and regulators.
  • Familiarity with analog design methodologies and layout constraints.
  • Experience with RC extraction and EM/IR analysis is a plus.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively with cross-functional, distributed teams.
Education & Experience:
  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience.
  • 10+ years of experience in analog/mixed-signal layout design.
Location:
Hybrid – United States

job.title: Principal Engineer - High Speed Analog IC Research &Development (32629)

Hybrid, United States

job.title: Senior Mixed -Signal ASIC Design Engineer (32626)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a Senior Mixed-Signal ASIC Design Engineer to join a dynamic team working on next-generation integrated circuits for high-performance communication and data center applications.


Responsibilities:
  • Design and simulate high-resolution data converters (DACs/ADCs) and low-power analog circuits such as bandgap references, opamps, and output buffers.
  • Develop layout floorplans, supervise layout activities, and provide clear guidance to layout engineers (hands-on layout work may be required).
  • Create analog test plans and collaborate with product/test engineering teams for characterization and validation.
  • Follow established design methodologies and release processes to ensure product quality and consistency.
  • Model circuit behavior using Verilog-A/AMS for design verification.
Key Qualifications:
  • Strong expertise with analog/mixed-signal design tools (Cadence Virtuoso, Spectre, Layout XL, Mentor AFS, Calibre).
  • Proven experience in taking data converters from design to production.
  • In-depth understanding of CMOS and high-voltage (BCD) design, layout effects, and ESD protection.
  • Skilled in circuit analysis, device physics, and analog design methodology.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively in cross-functional, distributed teams.
  • Capable of mentoring junior engineers and independently resolving complex design challenges.
Education & Experience:
  • Staff Design Engineer: M.S. in Electrical Engineering with 8+ years of experience or Ph.D. with 8+ years.
  • Principal Design Engineer: M.S. with 12+ years or Ph.D. with 12+ years of experience.
Location:
Hybrid – United States

job.title: Power BI Architect (32633)
job.description:
Myticas direct client is seeking Power BI Architect at Waukegan, IL (Hybrid, 3 days in the office, 3 days of choice Monday – Thursday. Onsite Hybrid schedule is mandatory, cannot be altered)

Duration: 6+ month contract ( potential to extend)

TOP 5 SKILLS:
  1. Experience with design and architecture
  2. Experience with data modelling
  3. Experience with Performance Optimization.
  4. Experience as a BI Architect or similar role, with 5-7 years’ experience in Power BI.
  5. Strong expertise in full Microsoft BI Suite, data modeling, DAX, and Power Query.

JOB SUMMARY:
We are seeking a highly skilled Power BI Architect to join our dynamic team. As a Power BI Architect, you will be responsible for designing and implementing effective BI solutions that transform data into actionable insights. You will lead the strategic development of our Power BI platform, ensuring scalability, reliability, and optimal performance.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Design and Architecture: Develop and design the architecture of the Power BI platform, Power Automate, and Power Apps, ensuring alignment with business requirements and best practices.
  • Data Modeling: Create efficient and scalable dimensional data models that facilitate data analysis and reporting.
  • Dashboard Development: Lead the development of dynamic and interactive dashboards that provide valuable insights to stakeholders.
  • Integration: Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to integrate Power BI with various data sources and systems.
  • Performance Optimization: Identify and implement strategies to optimize the performance of Power BI reports and dashboards.
  • Security: Ensure data security and compliance with organizational policies and industry standards.
  • Strategy and Planning: Advise on BI strategy and roadmaps, aligning business needs with technology advancements.
  • Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users and junior team members, promoting effective use of Power BI tools.
  • Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of architectural designs, configurations, and project specifications.

Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field.
  • Proven experience as a BI Architect or similar role, with 5-7 years’ experience in Power BI.
  • Strong expertise in full Microsoft BI Suite, data modeling, DAX, and Power Query.
  • Experience with SQL, Python, Jupyter Notebooks, and integrating Power BI with various data sources.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
  • Ability to lead projects and work collaboratively in a team environment.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience with Azure data services and cloud technologies.
  • Familiarity with other BI tools and platforms.
  • Power BI certification is a plus.

job.title: Senior SAP EWM consultant (32622)

job.title: Business Systems Analyst with QA (32632)
job.description:
Myticas direct client is seeking Business Systems Analyst with QA experience at Waukegan, IL (Hybrid-3 days onsite)

Duration: 5 months (with a possibility of extension)

Description
The BSA/QA will play a critical role in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions. This individual will work closely with the project team and stakeholders to understand their business requirements and do document them in User Stories to then be developed. The BSA/QA will create test cases for user stories and will execute these tests and clearly documenting results and creating defects where needed.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and document detailed business requirements and functional specifications.
  • Analyze existing business processes, identify areas for improvement, and evaluate potential solutions to increase efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Assist in the design and implementation of software solutions that meet the business needs and integrate with existing systems where necessary.
  • Develop test plans and coordinate testing efforts to ensure that solutions meet business requirements and provide a high level of quality.
  • Create and maintain comprehensive documentation including process flows, business rules, and user guides.
  • Work closely with project managers and other team members to ensure timely delivery of project milestones and resolution of any issues that may arise.
  • Serve as a liaison between the IT department and business units by communicating project status, changes, and potential impacts to stakeholders.
  • Perform manual testing of software applications to ensure they meet user requirements.
  • Extensive experience on different types of testing that includes Functional testing, System Integration testing, Regression testing and UAT.
  • Experience in Agile/Scrum Environments on multiple Projects.
  • Experience in developing test plans, strategies, and test Scenarios.
  • Create, execute, and maintain test cases and test scripts. Collaborate with the development team to address and resolve identified issues in a timely manner.
  • Expertise in using JIRA for writing the Test Cases and tracking the Defects.
  • Excellent Communication skills-Verbal and written.

job.title: EDW Informatica ETL Developer (32541)
job.description:
EDW Informatica ETL Developer

Job Title: Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Informatica ETL Developer

Duration: 12 months with possible multi-year extension/s

Job Summary:

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is are seeking a highly experienced Informatica Extract Transform Load (ETL) Developer for a large, direct client in Springfield, IL. This opportunity will be an assent to the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) team.

This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining robust ETL processes using Informatica PowerCenter and Teradata. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of data integration, performance tuning, and data warehousing best practices, with a focus on supporting healthcare-related data systems.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement ETL solutions using Informatica PowerCenter to extract, transform, and load data from various agency sources.
  • Automate data staging processes and optimize ETL job scheduling for performance and efficiency.
  • Administer and support ETL environments, including development and production systems.
  • Perform repository backups, recovery operations, and system maintenance.
  • Develop mappings, mapplets, sessions, and workflows using a wide range of Informatica transformations.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot ETL jobs across development, testing, and production environments.
  • Write and optimize complex SQL queries and Unix Shell scripts for data marts and interfaces in Teradata.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements, document technical solutions, and support project planning.
  • Participate in unit, integration, and system testing.
  • Provide technical support, mentoring, and guidance to team members.

job.title: Hybrid Work-French Legal Invoice Analyst/Initial Reviewer (W-2101) (32444)
job.description:
Location: Hybrid Contract Position | Minneapolis, MN
NOTE: W2 Candidates Only!

Myticas's direct client, based in Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a Legal Invoice Analyst/Initial Reviewer for a hybrid contract position.

Position Overview:

The Legal Invoice Analyst I is responsible for the prompt, accurate, and efficient auditing of electronically submitted legal fee and expense invoices from law firms and vendors. The selected candidate will ensure compliance with billing guidelines by adjusting invoice line items that violate provisions and documenting justifications for those adjustments. The analyst will also provide guidance to business unit partners on issues or opportunities within the Legal Billing Audit process.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Efficiently and accurately review legal invoice entries.
  • Receive legal invoice assignments from the Operations Support Specialist or self-assign tasks from the intake queue.
  • Verify compliance with legal billing guidelines for submitted invoices.
  • Ensure the accuracy of UTBMS task codes (Fee, Activity, and Expense codes) applied to invoice line items.
  • Document reasons for any adjustments made to invoice line items, specifying the violated billing guideline and rationale for the adjustment amount.
  • Forward audited legal invoices through the appropriate review chain as required.
  • Collaborate with Legal Invoice Analysts and Quality Assurance Analysts.
  • Exercise discretion and sound judgment when making audit and adjustment decisions.
  • Demonstrate a strong understanding of legal terminology and claims-related legal situations, with multijurisdictional exposure preferred.
  • Work independently with minimal supervision after training.
  • Utilize electronic legal bill submission and auditing software efficiently.
  • Organize work to ensure the prompt and efficient review of legal invoices within designated timeframes.
  • Apply basic business math skills and maintain appropriate business telephone etiquette.

Required Skills, Qualifications, and Experience:

Education:

  • Paralegal Certification or a Bachelor's Degree in a legal-related discipline, or equivalent work experience.

Experience:

  • 1-3 years of experience in a legal services or legal auditing environment.
  • Must speak, read and write French--for this opening.
  • Familiarity with legal billing processes.
  • Strong understanding of federal and/or state rules of civil procedure.

Technical Skills:

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
  • Experience with legal billing systems and processes.

Core Competencies:

  • Teamwork: Collaborate effectively with the Legal Billing Audit Center of Excellence (LBACOE) and other business units while providing constructive feedback.
  • Problem Solving: Think independently and make sound decisions. Identify necessary resources to aid in decision-making and take proactive steps to resolve problems.
  • Leadership: Demonstrate personal accountability for day-to-day tasks and collaborate with other business units to achieve results.
  • Planning and Organizing: Prioritize tasks to achieve short- and long-term goals within designated timeframes.
  • Technology: Partner with technology experts to identify gaps and develop impactful solutions.
  • Learning: Adapt to changes in the marketplace and workforce by acquiring or modifying knowledge through study, experience, or instruction.
  • Initiative: Exhibit self-direction and translate ideas into action to achieve results.
INDSponsor

job.title: Local to MN-Hybrid, Attorney (J.D)(W-4499) (32601)
job.description:
Legal Invoice Review Quality Assurance Analyst II
Location: Hybrid in St. Cloud, MN or Minneapolis, MN (Must be located in MN; flexible for 2 days per week onsite)
Contract Type: Hybrid Contract Position
Employment Type: W2 only

NOTE: Bilingual (French, German, Italian and/or Spanish) would be a plus, medical malpractice experience would be nice as well.

Myticas' direct client, based in St. Cloud, MN or Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a Legal Invoice Review Quality Assurance Analyst II (QA Analyst II) for a hybrid contract position. This role focuses on quality assurance testing within the Legal Bill Analysis Center of Excellence (LBACOE). The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in legal concepts related to invoice auditing across multiple areas of law.

Required Qualifications:

  • Juris Doctor (JD) degree from an ABA-accredited law school is required.
  • Strong understanding of legal billing guidelines and UTBMS task codes.
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision after training.
  • Excellent written communication skills, including grammar, syntax, style, spelling, and proofreading.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
  • Bilingual (French, German, Italian and/or Spanish) would be a plus, medical malpractice experience would be nice as well

Job Responsibilities:

Quality Assurance & Invoice Review:

  • Conduct expert peer reviews of invoice analysts' work, applying specialized legal knowledge to ensure accuracy and compliance with billing guidelines.
  • Assess legal context and terminology within invoices and make necessary adjustments to previously modified line-item entries.
  • Document comprehensive justifications for adjustments, citing specific billing guideline violations.
  • Ensure accurate classification of UTBMS task, fee, activity, and expense codes.
  • Use discretion and legal expertise to correct both adjusted and non-adjusted invoice line items.

Appeals & Mediation:

  • Serve on the Appeals Team, engaging in written communication with law firms to resolve disputes over invoice adjustments.
  • Participate in legal expert-to-expert discussions to reach mutually agreeable resolutions on disputed invoice adjustments, in alignment with client directives.
  • Handle escalated appeals mediation, including drafting written summaries for clients and attending resolution conferences with law firms, management, and clients.
  • Work professionally with law firms via written communications to resolve disputes while maintaining integrity in the legal billing process.

Collaboration & Process Improvement:

  • Support business unit partners by identifying process improvements and opportunities within the Legal Bill Analysis (LBA) process.
  • Collaborate with audit and appeals teams to interpret client guidelines and resolve complex legal invoicing scenarios.
  • Provide feedback to the CIOX Artificial Intelligence Decision Science team to improve machine learning functionality for invoice auditing.

Additional Skills & Responsibilities:

  • Conduct periodic audits and data analysis to support performance metrics and reporting.
  • Organize workflow efficiently to review invoices promptly and accurately.
  • Communicate effectively in both oral and written form to obtain and deliver information.
  • Possess strong business math skills and appropriate telephone communication skills.
  • Ability to analyze legal service agreements and develop effective operational tools.
  • Proficient in electronic legal billing software and Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Maintain professionalism while working independently with minimal supervision.

job.title: Sr Program Management Consultant - Medical Devices (32608)
job.description:
Sr Project Management Consultant
Location: Waukegan, IL (3 days onsite)
Company: Myticas's direct client based in North Chicago, IL

NOTE:
Need a seasoned, higher level Program Manager having experience managing projects related to medical devices or medical equipment. That kind of specialized expertise is essential given the technical and regulatory aspects of the EEG brain scan initiative.
Will be meeting with VP and Vendors as well as being responsible for budget management.


Summary

One of our Direct clients is looking to add a Seasoned Sr Project/Program Management Consultant to their team. The main project is tied to an EEG brain scan technology and the person needs to have an SDLC background. Experience with medical devices and phase 1 installation would be a great nice-to-have. This individual will be meeting with VP and Vendors as well as being responsible for budget management.

Key Responsibilities

  • Initiate and Plan Project: Works with business and IT management to establish and gain consensus on project goals, objectives, financials and deliverables. Responsible for building the plan and resources needs to accomplish the scope.
  • Project Control: Assess the degree to which changes to scope, issues and risks will affect the project working with business and IT management and sponsor to gain agreement for resolution. Measure performance to assure the project is progressing as compared to original plan and budget.
  • Executing and Closing Project: Develops and executes a work plan obtaining authorized resources to ensure all activities are performed. Leads team in delivering project scope. Gather lessons learned and obtain final project approval from sponsor and stakeholders.
  • Project Communication: Communicate project progress by producing project reports to provide timely and accurate program status and decision support information to project teams, business, and IT management. Makes recommendations based on current project status to resolve issues and manage risks.
  • Resource and Team Management: Coordinate resources to ensure project needs are addressed and effectively assign tasks and deliverables to team members based upon their abilities. Motivates project team in order to deliver project outcomes.
  • Quality Management: Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and functional policies and procedures.
  • Decisions: Make decisions that impact project level activities. Influences or has final decision authority for project budget.
  • Financial Control: Develops and manages a financial plan with multi-million dollar spend. Tracks actual spend, accruals, proactively creates spend estimates on a regular basis (at least monthly) and coordinates estimates and invoices with project vendors, in order to maintain spend at +/- 10% of the overall project budget.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.
  • Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word skills are required.
  • 5-10 years of experience in project management
  • Experience managing SDLC projects.
  • Key Stakeholders:
  • Business and Technology resources; varying levels of leadership

Preferred Qualifications

  • PMP Certification
  • PPM Tool experience
  • Pharmaceutical experience
  • Experience managing projects to deliver or enhance validated systems.

This is a hybrid position requiring both remote and onsite work in Waukegan, IL.

job.title: High Performance Computing (HPC) Administrator (32447)
job.description:
The HPC Administrator’s primary focus is to monitor, maintain, troubleshoot and support HPC nodes which are integral to the day-to-day operation of our client. These activities include managing the hardware, software installations and configuration, optimization and management of the environment. Other activities include operational, day-to-day requests including migration of nodes, system access requests, resolution of security alerts, and providing second level problem assessment, triage, research, and resolution of incidents and requests, and capable of applying technical expertise at a superior level. Assist with the creation and publication of end user documentation as new technology is released and systems are migrated.

Candidates must be willing to be onsite in the office at least 4 days per week.

Main Responsibilities

  • Identify, diagnose, and resolve level two problems for users of the software and hardware, LAN and WAN, VPN, the Internet, mobile devices, and new computer technology; communicate solutions to end-users.
  • Respond to more complex issues (second line support) escalated by the first line support using problem-solving skills and analysis to identify root causes of issues, determine course of action and propose creative solutions.
  • Manage day-day operations and support of the HPC environment (Linux).
  • Take ownership of capacity, availability and performance of the HPC cluster(s).
  • Support end users in the submission and management of jobs based on Slurm and OpenHPC.
  • Migrate existing nodes as required to Linux.
  • Implement and manage a system based on Foreman or similar to manage patching and oversee cluster management.
  • Implement patches and upgrades to Linux, Slurm and OpenHPC as required.
  • Install new servers and storage, build new clusters, configure and manage Linux distributions, hypervisors (KVM) and tooling.
  • Automate where possible to increase efficiency of operations.
  • Execute upon firewall access requests to the environment.
  • Escalate priority support issues to senior staff and/or other corporate technology groups
  • Collect and document all relevant information prior to escalation to allow senior staff to operate efficiently
  • Document, track and monitor problems to ensure timely resolution.
  • Assist in tracking helpdesk calls pertaining to application, networking, and systems problems and issues.
  • Assign username, password and access right permissions for multiple proprietary applications, as well as client software.
  • Identity Management and multifactor authentication with integration between Active Directory and Linux platforms.
  • Perform hardware & software audits.
  • Product research and evaluation.
  • Provide emergency support on incidents as required.
  • Perform occasional after-hours maintenance.
  • Incident on-call rotation as required.
  • Day-to-day operational support.

Education & Experience Required

  • A Diploma or Degree in a relevant area of study with a preference for Computer Science together with demonstrated operational network-related experience.
  • Minimum of 2 years in Information Technology (with a related University Degree) or minimum of 7 years in Information Technology (with a three-year College Diploma).
  • Industry certifications such as MCSE, CISSP are a strong asset.

Specialized Skills, Knowledge & Abilities

  • In-depth and demonstrated experience in the installation and operation of Linux platforms in an Enterprise environment (Ubuntu/RedHat).
  • Experience in the use of KVM or other hypervisors.
  • Experience in HPC tools such as Slurm, LSF or GridEngine.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of HPC clusters and use cases.
  • Working technical knowledge of network systems.
  • Working technical knowledge of current systems software, protocols and standards including Active Directory.
  • Identity management using Microsoft Identity Manager and Azure AD Connect.
  • Solid understanding of the Windows based endpoints.
  • Solid scripting experience (e.g. Bash)
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills.
  • Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
  • Strong interpersonal and organizational skills.
  • Must be well organized and able to grasp system concepts and communicate their applications.
  • Must be capable of quickly learning new systems and associated software applications for proficient execution of tasks.
  • Ability to manage multiple demands with time related constraints in a fast-paced environment.
  • Prioritize and schedule work as necessary to maintain department standards and service level agreements
  • Ability to speak effectively before groups of internal employees, communicate technical information, create and deliver presentations and information sessions to both technical and nontechnical personnel.
  • Demonstrated experience in applying technical expertise and in-depth evaluation to solve complex problems in own area of expertise.
  • Ability to create and maintain documentation and training materials, including KB articles, for technical staff and end-user audiences.
  • Microsoft Windows experience is an asset.
  • Bilingualism (English/French) is an asset.

Decision Making & Supervision

  • Make decisions and recommendations within established procedures, based on troubleshooting and analysis.
  • Manage operating system and tooling upgrades.
  • Coordination with helpdesk, network/telecom, platform, and security teams.
  • Work under minimum supervision.

Working Conditions

  • Generally comfortable working conditions with lifting and onsite installations.
  • Moderate visual concentration in use of video display terminal.
  • Appropriate security clearances required.
  • Occasional off-hours support may be required.
  • Participation in group pager rotation (‘on call’).

job.title: NMS Developer (32446)
job.description:
As a Network Management System Developer, you’ll be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of our network by designing, implementing, testing and maintaining Operational Support Systems (OSS). Your role will be instrumental in optimizing network performance, enhancing efficiency, and ensuring a seamless customer experience.

Main Responsibilities

  • Design network management solutions to monitor and manage Carrier
  • Ethernet and IP services, ensuring optimal capacity, performance and reliability
  • Define configurations and notification data models using YANG
  • Define real-time network monitoring solutions
  • Program network automation with gNMI/gNOI/NETCONF/RESTCONF
  • Design, Develop and maintain automated scripts and tools to verify NMS functionality
  • Work with vendors to implement new OSS/NMS solutions
  • Review and approve design documents, test strategies, plans, and scripts
  • Maintain accurate documentation of OSS/NMS requirements, configurations, processes, and procedures
  • Resolve complex OSS/NMS implementation and network problems with cross-functional teams
  • Enforce security best practices to protect network systems and data integrity

Education and Experience Required

  • Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field
  • 2-5 experience in a similar role.
  • Proficient in Layer 2/3 protocols, YANG modeling, gRPC/gNMI/gNOI
  • Experience designing network management systems using Layer 2/3 protocols
  • Programming skills in modern C++, GNU C, Go, Python 3.x
  • TDD and BDD test frameworks
  • Knowledge of developing software in container hosted in Linux environment and microservices
  • Knowledge of Protobuf, XML, JSON IETF encoding, and template language (Jinja2)
  • Good problem-solving, and communication skills
  • Experience with NMS products like Netcracker Digital OSS, ONAP, Ciena Blue Planet, Amdocs

Knowledge in Protocols and Standards:

  • Layer 3 protocols: IP, OSPF, BGP, MPLS, SR-MPLS
  • Layer 2 protocols: Ethernet, VLAN, STP, LACP
  • MEF and TMF Standards

  • Knowledge of Protobuf, XML, JSON IETF encoding, and template language (Jinja2)
  • Good problem-solving, and communication skills
  • Experience with NMS products like Netcracker Digital OSS, ONAP, Ciena Blue Planet, Amdocs

Knowledge in Protocols and Standards:

  • Layer 3 protocols: IP, OSPF, BGP, MPLS, SR-MPLS
  • Layer 2 protocols: Ethernet, VLAN, STP, LACP
  • MEF and TMF Standards

job.title: Senior Organizational Change Management Consultant – Bilingual (French/English) (32523)

job.title: FPGA Developer, Senior (32549)
job.description:
Overview:
A leading provider of real-time video processing technology is seeking a Senior FPGA Developer to join its core signal processing team. This group is responsible for developing high-performance media transport and processing systems used by global clients in live production, broadcast, and media environments.

This is an opportunity to work on cutting-edge, high-bandwidth systems built on advanced FPGA platforms—delivering critical real-time features that enable professional-grade media production. You’ll be surrounded by a highly experienced team that values innovation, collaboration, and practical problem solving.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement RTL for advanced real-time media systems with interfaces including memory, PCIe, and hardware-accelerated video processing.

  • Develop transport protocol implementations (e.g., SDI, SMPTE 2110) within FPGAs.

  • Collaborate on system architecture—reviewing schematics, optimizing clocking, thermal considerations, and FPGA resource allocation.

  • Perform full IO ring designs for leading FPGA families (e.g., Arria10, Stratix-10, Ultrascale+, Agilex).

  • Define and document high-level system requirements; support component selection and scheduling.

  • Create simulation testbenches (Verilog/SystemVerilog); perform functional verification and debugging.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with software, hardware, and manufacturing teams through the full product lifecycle.

  • Mentor peers and support technical knowledge sharing within the team.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of hands-on FPGA design experience, preferably with exposure to video or audio systems.

  • Strong Verilog/SystemVerilog and scripting skills (TCL).

  • Experience with Intel and/or Xilinx FPGAs and their respective toolchains (Quartus, Vivado).

  • Familiarity with high-speed serial interfaces, DDR3/4, HBM, PLLs, and signal integrity principles.

  • Excellent debugging and validation skills; proficiency with lab tools (oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, WFMs, etc.).

  • Background in embedded systems (Linux, bash, C/C++) considered a plus.

  • Understanding of media production workflows and digital video standards (SMPTE, HDR, SDI) is advantageous.

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced engineering environment.

job.title: IT Director (PMO - Project Management Office) - THREE DAYS ONSITE (32554)
job.description:
Job Title: Director, IT (PMO)
Location: Ottawa – Hybrid (3 Days On-Site, Mandatory and Non-Negotiable)
Type: Full-Time, Permanent (8-Hour Workday)
Language Requirement: Bilingual Preferred (French/English)
Security Clearance: Must obtain clearance equivalent to Enhanced Reliability Status (Canada)
Eligibility: Must be a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident

About the Role

The Director of IT (PMO) is a strategic leadership position responsible for aligning IT initiatives with enterprise objectives and ensuring the successful delivery of high-impact technology projects. The Director will provide expert guidance, foster cross-functional collaboration, and oversee a portfolio of projects that deliver long-term organizational value.

This role will lead the development and enforcement of a consistent IT project management framework, ensuring compliance with standardized methodologies and governance practices. The Director will also provide senior leadership with timely insights into project health, risk exposure, and emerging opportunities across the portfolio.

Key Responsibilities

Strategic Portfolio Oversight

  • Drive the evolution and adoption of the IT PMO framework to ensure alignment with organizational goals.

  • Manage the enterprise-wide IT project portfolio, prioritizing initiatives and optimizing resource allocation.

  • Advise executive stakeholders using data-driven insights to support strategic investment and resource planning.

Project Leadership and Governance

  • Lead and mentor project managers and support staff to promote high performance and accountability.

  • Establish and enforce governance standards across all projects.

  • Proactively identify and manage risks, implementing mitigation strategies to ensure successful delivery.

Executive Collaboration

  • Engage regularly with senior leadership to align on digital strategy, planning, and delivery progress.

  • Prepare and deliver executive-level reports and presentations that support informed decision-making.

  • Handle sensitive and confidential project data with integrity and discretion.

Risk Management

  • Identify risks across individual projects and the broader portfolio, escalating critical issues as required.

  • Develop and implement contingency plans to ensure project continuity.

Process Optimization and Continuous Improvement

  • Analyze project outcomes to identify areas for improvement and incorporate lessons learned.

  • Promote the use of modern tools and delivery methodologies, including Agile and hybrid approaches.

  • Continuously refine PMO structures and practices to enhance organizational effectiveness.

Reporting and Metrics

  • Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) for project and portfolio success.

  • Provide concise, data-driven reports and dashboards to executive stakeholders.

Project Execution

  • Lead the end-to-end delivery of complex, high-impact IT projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within budget, and with strong stakeholder engagement.

Qualifications and Experience

Education

  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

Experience

  • Minimum of 8 years of progressive experience in IT project management.

  • At least 2 years in a leadership role managing a PMO or IT project portfolio.

Certifications

  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is required.

Key Skills

  • Demonstrated experience leading enterprise-wide IT projects and managing PMO teams.

  • Proven ability to work with C-suite executives and handle confidential information.

  • In-depth knowledge of project management methodologies, including Waterfall, Agile, and hybrid models.

  • Proficiency in tools such as Microsoft Project, Jira, and Smartsheet.

  • Strong interpersonal, analytical, and organizational skills.

  • Ability to manage multiple projects and competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.

job.title: SAP EWM Consultant (x2) (32555)
job.description:
Our client, a global organization, is seeking two experienced SAP EWM Consultants for upcoming contract engagements. The successful candidates will support a hybrid work environment in the Greater Toronto Area and bring strong functional and technical expertise in Extended Warehouse Management.

Responsibilities:

  • Proven track record on multiple full-cycle SAP EWM implementations

  • Deep functional knowledge across core EWM processes

  • Strong integration experience with SAP TM, SD, MM, and production modules

  • Experience with S/4HANA is a strong asset

  • Prior consulting experience with large, complex environments is preferred

Work Model: Hybrid – candidates must be able to attend onsite meetings in the GTA up to 3 times per week, as needed.

job.title: Optical Resident Engineer (32419)
job.description:
Job Title: Optical Resident Engineer
Primary Location: Charlotte, NC
Other Considered Locations: Columbus, OH; Tampa, FL; Austin, TX; Cerritos, CA
Note: Please indicate your desired work location at the top of your resume upon submission.

Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced Optical Resident Engineer to work on-site at a customer location. While Charlotte, NC is the preferred location, candidates located near Columbus, OH; Tampa, FL; Austin, TX; or Cerritos, CA will also be considered. Periodic travel to Dallas, TX will be required. All business travel must receive prior written managerial approval, which must accompany receipt submissions via Fieldglass.

Key Requirements

Candidates must meet the following requirements, be able to clearly discuss relevant experience during a technical interview, and ensure such experience is reflected in the resume:

  • 10+ years of experience with a telecom equipment vendor or service provider, specifically configuring, monitoring, and troubleshooting Long Haul (LH) and Metro Optical DWDM networks.
  • 7+ years of hands-on experience using optical design tools for generating design packages, managing optical power budgets, and applying knowledge of various amplifier types.
  • 7+ years of experience with optical network management systems, particularly NFM-T.
  • Experience in IP networking.
  • Practical experience with the implementation of GMPLS and CDC technologies in DWDM networks is preferred.
  • Product knowledge preferred: 1830 PSS, 1350 OMS (WS-NOC), EPT, and CPB tools.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills with clients.

Role Responsibilities

The Optical Resident Engineer will serve in a consultative capacity, working closely with customers and internal teams across network strategy, design, implementation, and support activities. Key responsibilities include:

  • Developing network architectures and service designs aligned with customer requirements and industry best practices.
  • Producing network implementation and migration plans.
  • Configuring optical equipment and services.
  • Supporting and testing networks during all stages of deployment.
  • Conducting audits and assessments to ensure network compliance with customer expectations.
  • Formulating and implementing network management strategies.
  • Preparing and reviewing technical statements of work.
  • Creating and delivering customer training materials.
  • Evaluating network performance, scalability, manageability, and security.
  • Recommending strategies for network performance optimization.
  • Collaborating with internal teams to drive product enhancements.
  • Conducting network and customer readiness testing.
  • Building and maintaining strong relationships with both technical and management stakeholders.
  • Supporting critical network events during scheduled maintenance windows, which may require work during off-hours.

Qualifications

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field; equivalent work experience will also be considered.

Experience:

  • 10+ years of hands-on experience in optical DWDM network engineering.
  • 7+ years of experience in optical design and network management.
  • Familiarity with 1830 PSS, 1350 OMS, EPT, and CPB tools.
  • Experience with GMPLS and CDC technologies is a plus.
  • Proven ability to communicate complex technical information to clients effectively.

job.title: Senior Full Stack Developer (.NET 8 / Angular 17) (32481)

job.title: IP Network Architect (32569)
job.description:
The Senior IP Network Architect is a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on all aspects of the Network design and works with internal teams and external contractors to ensure designs, implementation decisions, validation plans and documentation reflect the business requirements and objectives of the program.
Networking
  • Lead the design of complex IP network architectures, considering business requirements, scalability, and performance.
  • Possess a strong command of network platforms and appliances, including routers, switches, firewalls, SDWAN controllers, IPSEC VPN gateways, and deep packet inspection tools.
  • In coordination with the Network and System Engineering teams attend, contribute and produce materials for internal and external design and system engineering reviews for Network Engineering related activities.
  • Prepare and deliver materials including presentations, reference documentation and test strategies for network equipment deployment and operation.
  • Develop and oversee plans including product idea investigations, proof of concept, service validation and product demonstrations in lab.
  • Maintain a deep understanding of industry standards and protocols related to segment routing, such as IS-IS, OSPF, BGP, and MPLS.
  • Maintain familiarity with transport network technologies including Segment Routing (SR-MPLS) and Software Defined Networking (SDN).
  • Assess, evaluate, and recommend network platforms and appliances, hardware, and software solutions to meet business requirements.
  • Represent the Network Engineering team by documenting and delivering network requirements to hardware and software development teams specifically in the areas of customer facing MEF 3.0 interface and networking design support requirements.
Security and Compliance
  • Security and Compliance:
  • Design and implement secure network solutions with a focus on firewall configurations, IPSEC VPNs, and deep packet inspection techniques.
  • Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices for network security.
  • Optimization and Performance:
  • Continuously monitor network performance, analyzing metrics and conducting assessments to identify bottlenecks, vulnerabilities, and areas for improvement. Develop strategies to optimize network performance, enhance security, and ensure high availability.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance network performance and reliability.
  • Experience with network automation and scripting using tools such as Python, Ansible, or similar.
  • Emerging Technologies:
  • Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices related to IP networking and network appliances.
  • Proactively recommend and lead the adoption of new technologies that align with business goals.
Vendor Management
  • Collaborate with vendors to evaluate products, negotiate contracts, and ensure the successful deployment and operation of network appliances.
  • Technical Leadership:
  • Provide mentorship and guidance to junior network engineers, sharing your expertise and promoting professional growth.
  • Troubleshooting and Support:
  • Lead in-depth troubleshooting and root cause analysis of network issues, providing timely and effective resolutions.
Education & Experience
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field or equivalent work experience.
  • 10+ years of progressive experience in designing and architecting IP networks, with a focus on routing, firewalls, SDWAN, IPSEC VPNs, and deep packet inspection.
  • Understanding of Metro Ethernet Forum (MEF) standards and objectives as they relate to Carrier Ethernet Services.
  • Professional certifications such as CCIE, CCNP, CISSP or equivalent are highly desirable.
  • Expertise in network appliance evaluation, selection, and integration.
  • In-depth understanding of security principles and practices as they relate to network architecture.
  • Proven experience with network troubleshooting, performance optimization, and security enhancement.
  • Strong knowledge of industry-leading routing protocols, firewall technologies, SDWAN solutions, IPSEC VPNs, and deep packet inspection methods.
  • Experience with network automation and scripting using tools such as Python, Ansible, or similar.
  • Leadership experience and the ability to mentor junior team members.
  • Excellent communication (verbal, written, presentation) and interpersonal skills.
  • Comfortable leading meetings and able to communicate issues and trends to senior management and other groups at the appropriate level of detail.
  • Communicates well with own team and across organizational boundaries to ensure the successful completion of shared goals.
Working Conditions
  • Working conditions are generally comfortable typical of an office environment with occasional work within Data Centres.
  • Occasional international travel is anticipated.

job.title: Senior Packet Processing Software Developer (32079)
job.description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Software Engineer with expertise in Packet Processing to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in designing and optimizing high-performance network systems, with a strong background in developing scalable, low-latency solutions for data-intensive environments. In this role, you will work on cutting-edge technologies to enhance network protocols and packet processing frameworks. Your contributions will play a key role in delivering robust, reliable, and efficient network operations, ensuring our systems meet the evolving demands of modern infrastructure.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with experienced engineers in the design, coding, testing, and maintenance of software applications.
  • Develop and maintain embedded software modules using programming languages such as C++ and Python.
  • Design and implement high-performance packet processing applications using DPDK and similar frameworks.
  • Optimize network functions for maximum throughput and minimal latency.
  • Develop and maintain packet processing pipelines for various network functions.
  • Troubleshoot complex performance issues in packet processing applications.
  • Assist in the implementation of networking solutions to ensure seamless communication between software components.
  • Contribute to the development of software tools, libraries, and frameworks to enhance overall product quality and efficiency.
  • Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to improve code quality and adherence to coding standards.
  • Collaborate with the team to troubleshoot and resolve software defects and technical issues.
  • Support the integration of software components on Linux operating systems.
  • Assist in the testing and validation of software features to ensure functionality and performance meet specified requirements.
  • Utilize cloud technologies to enhance software deployment and management.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers and designers, to understand requirements and contribute to technical discussions.
  • Maintain clear and organized documentation of software designs, processes, and development tasks.
  • Demonstrate effective teamwork and communication skills, both orally and in writing.
  • Lead the design, development, and implementation of advanced satellite ground segment software systems, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability.

Education & Experience Required:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
  • In-depth knowledge of packet processing development.
  • Experience with the Vector Packet Processing (VPP) framework is a plus.
  • Deep understanding of DPDK architecture and APIs.
  • Familiarity with modern NIC features (e.g., RSS, checksum offload, scatter-gather).
  • Experience with AF_XDP or similar kernel bypass technologies.
  • Strong understanding of Linux-based network stacks, kernel modules, and performance optimization.
  • Ideally 8+ years of experience in C/C++ for low-level network programming and high-performance packet processing.
  • Solid understanding of networking concepts and protocols, including TCP/IP, UDP, VXLAN, GRE, etc.
  • Familiarity with cloud technologies is a plus.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to collaborate effectively within a diverse team.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Enthusiasm for learning new technologies and tools.
  • Detail-oriented with a commitment to producing high-quality software.
  • Ability to design software with consideration for hardware resource constraints.
  • Experience in software development for satellite communication systems is a plus.

job.title: Cloud Operations Manager (Senior Lead, Operations) (32293)
job.description:
SCOPE

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Manager, Cloud Operations to lead and optimize our Azure cloud infrastructure and services. This role is critical in ensuring the scalability, reliability, and security of our cloud environments while driving operational excellence. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of cloud architectures, automation, and best-in-class operational practices.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead the Cloud Operations team to ensure high availability, performance, and security of cloud-based applications and services.
  • Develop and execute a strategic roadmap for cloud operations, aligning with business objectives.
  • Oversee incident management, disaster recovery, and business continuity strategies for cloud environments to support and align efforts to meet customer needs.
  • Drive automation and infrastructure-as-code (IaC) adoption to improve efficiency and reduce operational overhead.
  • Optimize cloud cost management and governance to ensure cost-effective usage of resources.
  • Collaborate with security, compliance, and IT teams to enforce best practices and regulatory requirements.
  • Establish and monitor KPIs, SLAs, and performance metrics to continuously improve service delivery.
  • Provide leadership, mentorship, and development opportunities for a team of cloud engineers and operations professionals.
  • Communicate proactively with customers and internal team members to deliver business value as a part of daily work management.
  • Stay up to date with emerging technologies, trends, and industry best practices to drive innovation.

REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • Certifications in cloud technologies.
  • Industry-accepted certifications in management.
  • Domain knowledge of banking and financial institutions and/or large enterprise IT environment is desirable.
  • 10+ years of experience in IT operations with at least 5 years focused on cloud services.
  • Proven experience in managing cloud environments (AWS or Azure) at an enterprise scale.
  • Strong understanding of automation tools (Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation) and CI/CD pipelines.
  • Hands-on experience with monitoring, logging, and observability tools (Datadog, Splunk, Prometheus, Azure Monitoring, etc.).
  • Deep knowledge of networking, security best practices, and compliance frameworks (ISO, SOC2, NIST, etc.).
  • Strong leadership and team management skills with experience in developing high-performing teams.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to operational challenges.
  • Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.

SOFT SKILLS

  • Customer-facing skills: Connect, Engage, Listen, Explain, Facilitate, Coordinate, Follow-through.
  • Strong, clear, and concise written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to foster team collaboration.
  • Ability to negotiate and convince.
  • Ability to identify innovative solutions to problems.
  • Out-of-the-box thinking approach.
  • Ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions.
  • Ability to collaborate and communicate to achieve positive outcomes.
  • Detail-oriented.
  • Strong ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
  • Able to work under stress and conflicting timelines when necessary.
  • Proactive with a strong desire to learn.
  • Self-driven, with high enthusiasm and ambition to succeed.

job.title: Senior Software Technical Support Specialist (32305)
job.description:
The Senior SoftwareTechnical Support Specialist will provide expert-level technical assistance and strategic support the customers, partners, and cross-functional teams. This role involves complex issue resolution, leadership in support process improvement, ownership of professional service projects focused on product customization and integrations, deploying software solutions, onboarding new customers, and proactive engagement in optimizing team tools, processes, and customer issues. This individual will drive support initiatives, lead escalations, and act as a liaison with the engineering team to implement solutions resolving customer-reported bugs and issues.

Requirements

Essential Functions

  • Lead and Resolve Advanced Technical Issues: Provide exceptional, senior-level support by diagnosing and resolving complex technical issues for customers, partners, and sales engineers, demonstrating technical leadership and initiative.
  • Deployment and Customer Onboarding: Manage the deployment of our clients software solutions, ensuring smooth transitions for new customers and providing comprehensive onboarding to maximize product adoption and success.
  • Customer Impact Focus: Act as the primary point of escalation for challenging, high-impact technical issues, driving timely and effective resolutions for mission-critical customer needs.
  • Project Leadership in Professional Services: Lead professional service projects aimed at product customization and integrations, coordinating with customers to understand requirements and deliver solutions aligned with their business needs.
  • Critical Availability: Provide on-call support for critical escalations outside standard business hours as needed, prioritizing rapid resolution and customer satisfaction.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with development, QA, and product management teams to assist in developing and testing patches, updates, and scripts for issue resolution and software enhancements.
  • Team Mentorship and Skill Development: Mentor junior team members, fostering skill enhancement and knowledge-sharing across the support team.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Experience & Expertise:

  • Minimum of 7 years of experience in technical support or related fields in a software company, with a track record of successfully managing complex production environments.
  • Hands-on experience with Windows, Linux, and Mac OS environments, as well as multi-platform troubleshooting.
  • Networking knowledge, including TCP/IP, DNS, and SSL, with experience in packet capture and analysis.

Technical Proficiency:

  • Background in cloud infrastructure services (AWS, Azure) and familiarity with modern cloud-native architectures.
  • Familiarity with database administration (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and system automation tools to enhance support processes.
  • Competency in scripting or coding in one or more languages and familiarity with automation tools.
  • Experience with real-time data integrations using webhooks, API listeners, and other middleware solutions to enhance system interoperability.

Analytical & Troubleshooting Skills:

  • Strong diagnostic skills and proficiency in root-cause analysis, with the ability to implement proactive, preventative measures.
  • Ability to synthesize data insights to predict and address system bottlenecks and inefficiencies.

Leadership & Communication:

  • Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, for conveying complex technical information to diverse audiences.
  • Proven ability to lead support projects and initiatives, with a strong focus on customer satisfaction, teamwork, and collaboration.

Additional Desirable Skills:

  • Experience in technical support leadership roles, with the ability to delegate, prioritize, and coach effectively.
  • Expertise in technical documentation and knowledge management systems to empower both internal teams and end-users.
  • Ability to work flexible hours to support a 24/7 environment and provide guidance in high-pressure, critical situations.
INDSponsor

job.title: Project Manager (IT) (32567)
job.description:
BACKGROUND

Algonquin College of Applied Arts and Technology (AC) is a publicly funded English-language college and a member of Polytechnics Canada, located in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. The College serves the National Capital Region and the surrounding areas of Eastern Ontario, Western Quebec, and Upstate New York. AC has three campuses: the main campus in Ottawa, Ontario, and two secondary campuses in Perth and Pembroke, Ontario.

The Information Technology Services (ITS) department at Algonquin College provides support to approximately 65,000 individuals, including students, faculty, administrative staff, and distance learners.

DESCRIPTION OF WORK / DELIVERABLES

The Senior Project Manager will support the ITS department by leading and implementing multiple initiatives. The consultant will collaborate with IT leadership and other key stakeholders to ensure the effective planning, development, and execution of these initiatives, delivering all assigned projects on time, within scope, and on budget, in alignment with ITS PMO standards and best practices.

The Senior Project Manager will be responsible for the following:

  1. Oversee the established project vision. Define project objectives, scope, and deliverables in collaboration with project sponsors and stakeholders.
  2. Develop and maintain detailed project plans, identifying deliverables, estimating durations, and allocating resources. Manage comprehensive project documentation (e.g., requirements, scope, schedule, cost, communication, resources, risks, issues, change management, and quality).
  3. Monitor and control project progress in accordance with corporate policies and standards. Facilitate effective meetings and deliver milestone presentations, issue resolution strategies, and regular status updates. Provide comprehensive reporting and proactive problem-solving.
  4. Manage project risks, including contingency planning and critical path analysis. Ensure risk mitigation strategies are in place and executed effectively.
  5. Integrate and evaluate change management strategies. Monitor implementation efforts, address transition issues, and ensure business risks are mitigated through appropriate recommendations and follow-up.
  6. Ensure adherence to appropriate project management methodologies throughout the project lifecycle. Provide teams with necessary tools and support.
  7. Apply high-quality project and program management practices across all stages of the project lifecycle.
  8. Lead and manage cross-functional, multi-disciplinary teams to achieve project objectives.
  9. Manage communications and maintain effective working relationships with clients and stakeholders.
  10. Produce and deliver monthly reports, including project schedules, risk registers, and progress summaries.
  11. Collaborate with stakeholders and business partners to develop and implement comprehensive business cases supporting project recommendations.

REQUIREMENTS

The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Computer Engineering, or a related IT field.
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or equivalent experience.
  • 8 to 10 years of project or program management experience, including at least 5 years managing large-scale projects.
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience engaging a wide range of stakeholders.
  • Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and work collaboratively across departments.
